Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The user wants me to generate 20 thought-provoking, open-ended questions about the complex supply chain process described for a smartphone manufacturer. These questions should: 1. Focus on discovering more insights 2. Explore potential issues 3. Discuss strategies for improvement 4. Examine implications of various decisions

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Let me analyze the supply chain process to identify key areas where I can generate insightful questions: Key elements of the process: 1. RD and design phase 2. Component sourcing from multiple international suppliers (Taiwan, Japan, South Korea, Germany, US) 3. Manufacturing in Malaysia (247 operations) 4. Quality control and testing 5. Transportation to distribution centers (air and sea freight) 6. Regional distribution (Europe, North America, Asia, Latin America) 7. Final delivery to retailers, e-commerce, direct consumers 8. Inventory management and demand planning 9. Digital systems and data analytics 10. Compliance, quality assurance, environmental considerations 11. Warranty and after-sales support 12. Recalls and continuous improvement

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Areas for thought-provoking questions: 1. Supplier relationships and dependencies 2. Risk management and resilience 3. Technology and automation 4. Sustainability and environmental impact 5. Cost optimization 6. Quality control and compliance 7. Data and analytics 8. Geopolitical and regulatory issues 9. Human resources and labor 10. Customer experience and responsiveness 11. Innovation and continuous improvement 12. Financial considerations 13. Coordination and visibility 14. Crisis management 15. Strategic decision-making

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Now Ill craft 20 open-ended, thought-provoking questions that cover these areas. The questions should be genuinely curious, exploring different dimensions of the supply chain and encouraging deep analysis. Let me structure these questions to be varied and comprehensive
